description.narrative:
Organisation registry agencies and their code. These can be used as the prefix for an organisation identifier.
For general guidance about constructing Organisation Identifiers, please see http://iatistandard.org/organisation-identifiers/
In this list, description contains IATI specific usage notes, rather than a general description of the regsitration agency.
The categories on this list are ISO Country codes, except for XM which is used to indicate Multilateral/International Agency, and XI which is used to indicate International Organisations. This follows ISO's convention of reserving codes starting with X for "private use".
This list is maintained by the IATI Secretariat, but is a "NonEmbedded" codelist - which means changes and additions may be made at short notice, outside of published decimal and integer upgrade schedules. If a Registation Agency that you wish to use is not on this list, please contact support@iatistandard.org
This list was previously located at: https://docs.google.com/spreadsheet/ccc?key=0AnWngmdQt3stdFppMWdkcXJqVTRWTk9menR1N0FXNGc&usp=drive_web#gid=0

name.narrative: Banque Carrefour des entreprises / Kruispuntbank van ondernemingen
Canadian Revenue Agency / Agence du revenu du Canada

description.narrative: CRA_ACR is legal requirement for bilingual use

The Bogota Chamber of Commerce is a private, non-for-profit organization whose goal is to foster a sustainable Bogota-Region in the long term, by promoting its residents' prosperity, through services which enhance and strengthen the enterprise capabilities present in the region, and which improve the business environment with an impact over public policies.
The Central Business Register at Virk is available with English headings and categories. It can be used to search for information on all Danish businesses.

name.narrative: Common Directory of Organizational Units and Offices - DIR3
DIRECTORIO COMÚN de Unidades Orgánicas y Oficinas - DIR3

description.narrative: Charities are registered but no openly searchable database yet available.

name.narrative: Registre de Commerce et des Societies /Trade and Companies Register - Commercial Court Registry

description.narrative: Codes for use by IATI for UK Government Departments.

name.narrative: UK Government Departments, Agencies & Public Bodies

description.narrative: Use the final segment of the url (below /organisations) as the "registration number", converting all "-" to "_". Keep "registration number" portion all lowercase.

name.narrative: The Charity Commission for Northern Ireland
The Guernsey Registry at the Department of Commerce and Employment

description.narrative: NGO registration can also be done through Ministry Home affairs/ Kementerian Dalam Negeri

name.narrative: Ministry of Justice & Human Rights/ Kementerian Hukum Dan Hak

description.narrative: Company registration is done through Ministry of Justice & Human Rights/ Kementerian Hukum Dan Hak

name.narrative: Ministry of Foreign affairs/ Kementerian Luar Negeri

description.narrative: International NGO registration is done through Ministry of Foreign affairs/ Kementerian Luar Negeri
Registration for NGO in Indonesia can be done at the provincial level. Because there is regional autonomy, each provincial has different requirements. Website is just one example

name.narrative: Isle of Man Index of Registered Charities
Government of India, Minstry of Corporate Affairs

description.narrative: MCA regulates corporate affairs in India through the Companies Act, 1956, 2013 and other allied Acts, Bills and Rules.

name.narrative: Lesotho Council of Non Governmental Organisations
Ministry of Home Affairs - Central Committee for the Registration and Supervision of Organisations

description.narrative: The MHA assigns a registration number to each NGO - this number is time limited, for example 4 years, after which the registration is reviewed.

codelist-item.url: No url for the ministry (as at 2/10/2013)

name.narrative: The Council for Non Governmental Organisations in Malawi

description.narrative: There is a pdf file with a list of registered NGOs, but these do not appear to be registration numbers. New database is planned

The PCP Certification Programme seeks to bring transparency, accountability and good governance in the nonprofit sector in Pakistan. The first initiative of its kind in South Asia; it involves the evaluation of a nonprofit organisation on standardised parameters of internal governance, financial management and programme delivery.
Every business entry in Poland is assigned an ID in 3 different registries: business, court, and tax. This is the business register.
Every business entry in Poland is assigned an ID in 3 different registries: business, court, and tax. This is the tax register.
Every business entry in Poland is assigned an ID in 3 different registries: business, court, and tax. This is the court register.

name.narrative: Slovakia Ministry Of Interior Trade Register

description.narrative: Most organisations (including NGOs) have to be registered with the Ministry of Interior for the Trade Register Of The Slovak Republic (Živnostensky Register Slovenskej Republiky) and are allocated a unique registration number

NGO Board, Ministry of Internal Affairs

Index of U.S. Government Departments and Agencies

description.narrative: Use the final segment of the url (below /federal and excluding the extension) as the "registration number", converting all "-" to "_". Keep "registration number" portion all lowercase.

name.narrative: International Aid Transparency Initiative Organisation Identifier

description.narrative: XI-IATI is a list of organisation identifiers that is maintained by the IATI Secretariat. Any publisher may apply to the IATI Technical Team for an identifier to be generated.
Public Bodies aims to provide a unique ID for every part of every government.
See Donor, Agency, and Delivery Channel codes

name.narrative: United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs

description.narrative: OCHA is the part of the United Nations Secretariat responsible for bringing together humanitarian actors to ensure a coherent response to emergencies.
